newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian OTC market down 0.64 pct in slower trade.
newsitem.headline: Croatian OTC market down 0.64 pct in slower trade.

text.p: Croatian stocks edged down in a slow over-the-counter (OTC) trade in the week to April 25, the Varazdin market reported on Monday.
The seven-stock VIN index lost 0.64 percent as the weekly volume fell to 6,849 shares from 32,973, and the turnover was also down to 1.8 from 4.3 million the week before.
Of 28 active issues, 15 fell, four rose, seven remained flat and two traded for the first time.
Top loser, Zagreb-based electric cables producer Elka, went down 19.25 percent. It closed at 130 kuna trading 401 shares.
The week's top gainer was Itrian hotelier Anita Vrsar, up 25 percent to 1,150 kuna, but on small volume of 17 shares.
Most active issue, food concern Podravka, traded 2.571 shares, losing 1.3 percent to 303 kuna.
